trans-unit.source: Upgrade ExpressRoute Bandwidth Dynamically | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Upgrade ExpressRoute Bandwidth Dynamically | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to dynamically increase the bandwidth size of an ExpressRoute circuit with no downtime.
trans-unit.target: How to dynamically increase the bandwidth size of an ExpressRoute circuit with no downtime.

trans-unit.source: Upgrade your ExpressRoute circuit bandwidth dynamically with no downtime
trans-unit.target: Upgrade your ExpressRoute circuit bandwidth dynamically with no downtime

trans-unit.source: You can increase the size of an ExpressRoute circuit without any downtime.
trans-unit.target: You can increase the size of an ExpressRoute circuit without any downtime.

trans-unit.source: These instructions will help you update the bandwidth of an ExpressRoute circuit using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: These instructions will help you update the bandwidth of an ExpressRoute circuit using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the <link><linkText>ExpressRoute FAQ</linkText><title></title></link> page for more information on limits and limitations.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the <link><linkText>ExpressRoute FAQ</linkText><title></title></link> page for more information on limits and limitations.

trans-unit.source: Configuration prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Configuration prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin configuration, verify that you have the following prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin configuration, verify that you have the following prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: The latest version of Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: The latest version of Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: An active ExpressRoute circuit that has been configured and is in operation
trans-unit.target: An active ExpressRoute circuit that has been configured and is in operation

trans-unit.source: Configuring settings using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Configuring settings using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information please refer to the PowerShell documentation in <link><linkText>MSDN</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information please refer to the PowerShell documentation in <link><linkText>MSDN</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Import the PowerShell module for ExpressRoute.
trans-unit.target: Import the PowerShell module for ExpressRoute.

trans-unit.source: Get the details of the ExpressRoute circuit
trans-unit.target: Get the details of the ExpressRoute circuit

trans-unit.source: You can get the details of your ExpressRoute circuit using the following PowerShell Commandlet:
trans-unit.target: You can get the details of your ExpressRoute circuit using the following PowerShell Commandlet:

trans-unit.source: This command will return a list of all circuits you have created in the subscription.
trans-unit.target: This command will return a list of all circuits you have created in the subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following command to get details of a specific ExpressRoute circuit if you have the service key with you:
trans-unit.target: You can use the following command to get details of a specific ExpressRoute circuit if you have the service key with you:

trans-unit.source: Replace the <html></html> with the actual service key.
trans-unit.target: Replace the <html></html> with the actual service key.

trans-unit.source: Increase the bandwidth of the ExpressRoute circuit on the Microsoft side
trans-unit.target: Increase the bandwidth of the ExpressRoute circuit on the Microsoft side

trans-unit.source: Check the <link><linkText>ExpressRoute FAQ</linkText><title></title></link> page for supported bandwidth options for your provider.
trans-unit.target: Check the <link><linkText>ExpressRoute FAQ</linkText><title></title></link> page for supported bandwidth options for your provider.

trans-unit.source: You can pick any size greater than the size of your existing circuit.
trans-unit.target: You can pick any size greater than the size of your existing circuit.

trans-unit.source: Once you decided what size you need, you can use the following command to resize your circuit.
trans-unit.target: Once you decided what size you need, you can use the following command to resize your circuit.

trans-unit.source: Your circuit will have been sized up on the Microsoft side.
trans-unit.target: Your circuit will have been sized up on the Microsoft side.

trans-unit.source: Note that we will start billing you for the updated bandwidth option from this point on.
trans-unit.target: Note that we will start billing you for the updated bandwidth option from this point on.

trans-unit.source: Increase the bandwidth of the ExpressRoute circuit on the service provider side
trans-unit.target: Increase the bandwidth of the ExpressRoute circuit on the service provider side

trans-unit.source: Contact your connectivity provider (NSP / EXP) and provided them with information on the updated bandwidth.
trans-unit.target: Contact your connectivity provider (NSP / EXP) and provided them with information on the updated bandwidth.

trans-unit.source: Follow the order update process prescribed by your service provider to complete the task.
trans-unit.target: Follow the order update process prescribed by your service provider to complete the task.
